intro: Beccarinda erythrotricha, commonly known as the red-haired beccarinda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Beccarinda erythrotricha is typically found in woodland areas and is known for its ornamental value.
